text: Director of the National Science Foundation
sentence: Instructs the Director of the National Science Foundation (Director) to develop a report on the need and feasibility as well as construct plans to implement a program to recruit and train the next generation of AI professionals in US government.

Instructs the Director of the National Science Foundation (Director) to develop a report on the need and feasibility as well as construct plans to implement a program to recruit and train the next generation of AI professionals in US government.

Instructs the Director of the National Science Foundation (Director) to develop a report on the need and feasibility as well as construct plans to implement a program to recruit and train the next generation of AI professionals in US government.

Mandates that the report include statistical data on the federal AI workforce, assessments of current and future demand for AI expertise across the federal government and the ability of higher education institutions to prepare students to meet this demand, and an evaluation of the need for and feasibility of establishing a scholarship-for-service program for AI professionals in US government, as well as the possibility of leveraging existing programs such as the Federal Cyber Scholarship-for-Service Program.

Mandates that the report include statistical data on the federal AI workforce, assessments of current and future demand for AI expertise across the federal government and the ability of higher education institutions to prepare students to meet this demand, and an evaluation of the need for and feasibility of establishing a scholarship-for-service program for AI professionals in US government, as well as the possibility of leveraging existing programs such as the Federal Cyber Scholarship-for-Service Program.

Mandates that the report include statistical data on the federal AI workforce, assessments of current and future demand for AI expertise across the federal government and the ability of higher education institutions to prepare students to meet this demand, and an evaluation of the need for and feasibility of establishing a scholarship-for-service program for AI professionals in US government, as well as the possibility of leveraging existing programs such as the Federal Cyber Scholarship-for-Service Program.

Mandates that the report include statistical data on the federal AI workforce, assessments of current and future demand for AI expertise across the federal government and the ability of higher education institutions to prepare students to meet this demand, and an evaluation of the need for and feasibility of establishing a scholarship-for-service program for AI professionals in US government, as well as the possibility of leveraging existing programs such as the Federal Cyber Scholarship-for-Service Program.

Mandates that the report include statistical data on the federal AI workforce, assessments of current and future demand for AI expertise across the federal government and the ability of higher education institutions to prepare students to meet this demand, and an evaluation of the need for and feasibility of establishing a scholarship-for-service program for AI professionals in US government, as well as the possibility of leveraging existing programs such as the Federal Cyber Scholarship-for-Service Program.
Authorizes the Director and other appropriate agency heads to establish a Federal AI scholarship-for-service program to recruit and train AI professionals to achieve the missions of US government.

Requires the Director, in coordination with other agency heads, to establish criteria such as excellence in AI education and the ability to attract diverse students to designate qualified institutions of higher education that shall be eligible to participate in the program.

Requires the program to provide scholarships through qualified higher education institutions to students pursuing fields of study related to AI, provide scholarship recipients with temporary appointments related to work on AI in the federal government, prioritize placement of scholarship recipients in executive agencies, identify opportunities to promote multidisciplinary programs of study, support capacity building for educational institutions to enable them to train the next-generation AI workforce, create courses in technology ethics for scholarship recipients, and award fellowships to masters and doctoral students who are pursuing degrees or research in AI and related fields.

Requires the program to provide scholarships through qualified higher education institutions to students pursuing fields of study related to AI, provide scholarship recipients with temporary appointments related to work on AI in the federal government, prioritize placement of scholarship recipients in executive agencies, identify opportunities to promote multidisciplinary programs of study, support capacity building for educational institutions to enable them to train the next-generation AI workforce, create courses in technology ethics for scholarship recipients, and award fellowships to masters and doctoral students who are pursuing degrees or research in AI and related fields.

Instructs the Director to establish competitive awards to institutions to advance knowledge of risk assessment including the utilization of AI in our ability to understand and predict extreme events and natural hazards, create engineered system solutions and develop instrumentation for innovation in resilient infrastructure, and advance research on multidisciplinary wildfire science and behaviors related to increasing resilience.

text: Section 506(a) of the America COMPETES Reauthorization Act of 2010
sentence: Amends Section 506(a) of the America COMPETES Reauthorization Act of 2010 by adding AI and machine learning to the list of research areas that fall under information technologies for manufacturing that the Director can award grants to.

Amends Section 506(a) of the America COMPETES Reauthorization Act of 2010 by adding AI and machine learning to the list of research areas that fall under information technologies for manufacturing that the Director can award grants to.

Amends Section 506(a) of the America COMPETES Reauthorization Act of 2010 by adding AI and machine learning to the list of research areas that fall under information technologies for manufacturing that the Director can award grants to.

Instructs the Director to make competitive awards to institutions to support basic research to advance critical minerals mining strategies to make better use of domestic resources and eliminate national reliance on minerals subject to supply chain disruptions, including the application of AI for geological exploration of critical minerals and the application of machine learning for detection and sorting of critical minerals.

Instructs the Director to make competitive awards to institutions to support basic research to advance critical minerals mining strategies to make better use of domestic resources and eliminate national reliance on minerals subject to supply chain disruptions, including the application of AI for geological exploration of critical minerals and the application of machine learning for detection and sorting of critical minerals.

Requires the Director to conduct or support the development of a study on AI research capacity at US institutions of higher education.
Requires the Director to conduct or support the development of a study on AI research capacity at US institutions of higher education.

Requires the study to, at minimum, address which universities are putting out significant peer-reviewed AI research based on quantity and number of citations, which factors of these universities such as computing power enable their research, promising practices at these universities for advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion in AI research programs, geographic diversity of universities that have AI research-enabling factors, and how universities that are not currently top producers of AI research could improve, including potential pilot programs that the federal government could develop or support to help universities produce AI research.

text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget
sentence: Instructs the Director, in consultation with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the interagency committee established under the National AI Initiative Act of 2020, to develop and test models to inform the implementation of a government-wide data linkage and access infrastructure for statistical activities.

sentence: Instructs the Director, in consultation with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the interagency committee established under the National AI Initiative Act of 2020, to develop and test models to inform the implementation of a government-wide data linkage and access infrastructure for statistical activities.

Requires the Director to identify, and annually review and update a list of not more than 10 key technology focus areas, which includes AI, machine learning, autonomy, and related advances.

Establishes common rules for non-contractual fault-based civil claims related to damages caused by high-risk AI systems.
Establishes common rules for non-contractual fault-based civil claims related to damages caused by high-risk AI systems.
Requires disclosure of evidence from AI providers or users to substantiate claims, with courts empowered to order such disclosures.
Presumes non-compliance with duty of care if defendants fail to comply with evidence disclosure orders.
Presumes non-compliance with duty of care if defendants fail to comply with evidence disclosure orders.
Presumes a causal link between defendant s fault and AI system's output if certain conditions are met, allowing defendants to rebut the presumption.
Permits Member States to adopt more favorable rules for claimants, compatibility with Union law required.

text: Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration
sentence: Requires the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to adopt a performance and risk-based approach when reviewing requests for certificates of waiver under Section 107 of Title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, which establishes rules for the operation of small unmanned aircraft systems (sUAS) for commercial purposes.

text: Section 107 of Title 14, Code of Federal Regulations

text: Comptroller General of the United States
sentence: Instructs the Comptroller General of the United States to carry out a study in consultation with law enforcement, relevant federal agencies, private sector stakeholders (such as financial institutions, data and technology companies), to investigate major trafficking routes used by transnational criminal organizations and to what extent the trafficking routes are related.

text: Data-Sharing and Data-Driven Decision-Making Task Force
sentence: Creates the Data-Sharing and Data-Driven Decision-Making Task Force, comprised of twelve members appointed from the Senate and House of Representatives.
